Package sailpoint.tools

Class JsonHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.JsonHelper
  • public class JsonHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that helps to format various JSON responses.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success()
        Return a success JSON response with no details.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success​(java.lang.Object... keyValues)
        Return a success JSON response with the given parameters turned into key/value pairs in a details map. For example, the following call:

        success("firstname", "Joe", "lastname", "Cool")

        would return this:

        { "success": true, "firstname": "Joe", "lastname": "Cool" }

        Parameters:
        keyValues - The key value pairs to include in the result.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> attrs)
        Return a success JSON response with the given details.

        JSON for an empty object

        Return the JSON for an empty list.

      • emptyListResult

        public static java.lang.String emptyListResult​(java.lang.String countProp,
                                               java.lang.String objectsProp)
        Return the JSON for an empty list result that includes the total count and a list of objects. If either property name is null, that property is not included.

      • getObjectMapper

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper getObjectMapper​(JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Get a copy of the ObjectMapper for custom usage. We always copy this for safety, so the "common" one is not modified by custom code.
        Parameters:
        options - configuration options for the object mapper
        Returns:
        copy of the default object mapper configured with any options provided

      • getObjectMapperNoEscapes

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper getObjectMapperNoEscapes​(JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Creates a mapper that does NOT escape any characters. This would be used where it is not desired to escape any HTML or special characters. Standard JSON escapes are kept intact.

        Parameters:
        options - configuration options for the object mapper

        Returns:
        copy of the default object mapper configured with any options provided and no HTML chars escaped

      • keyValuesToJson

        public static java.lang.String keyValuesToJson​(JsonHelper.JsonOptions[] options,
                                               java.lang.Object... keyValues)
        Takes a list of key/value pairs con converts to a JSON string. If the first argument is null or empty string, returns an empty JSON object string. If key or value is null, the pair is ignored. An odd number of key/value pairs will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        options - JSON options to apply to the string for pretty printing and removing null properties
        keyValues - open-ended list of key/value pairs. Key objects will be converted to string.
        Returns:
        JSON string that may be formatted for easy reading

      • keyValuesToJsonNoEscapes

        public static java.lang.String keyValuesToJsonNoEscapes​(JsonHelper.JsonOptions[] options,
                                                        java.lang.Object... keyValues)
        Takes a list of key/value pairs con converts to a JSON string. If the first argument is null or empty string, returns an empty JSON object string. If key or value is null, the pair is ignored. An odd number of key/value pairs will throw an IllegalArgumentException. Uses standard JSON escapes.
        Parameters:
        options - JSON options to apply to the string for pretty printing and removing null properties
        keyValues - open-ended list of key/value pairs. Key objects will be converted to string.
        Returns:
        JSON string that may be formatted for easy reading

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson​(java.lang.Object o,
                                      JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Convert the given object to JSON. Primitive wrappers are returned as simple primitives, i.e. not a well-formed JSON object.

        NOTE: This always does "deep" serialization on the object

        Parameters:
        o - Object to serialize
        options - Any JsonOptions needed for serialization

        Returns:
        JSON string representation of the object using custom JSON character escapes

      • toJsonNoEscapes

        public static java.lang.String toJsonNoEscapes​(java.lang.Object o,
                                               JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Convert the given object to JSON. Primitive wrappers are returned as simple primitives, i.e. not a well-formed JSON object. Uses standard JSON escapes.

        NOTE: This always does "deep" serialization on the object

        Parameters:
        o - Object to serialize
        options - Any JsonOptions needed for serialization

        Returns:
        JSON string representation of the object using standard JSON character escapes

      • fromJson

        public static <T> T fromJson​(java.lang.Class<T> objectType,
                             java.lang.String json)
                      throws GeneralException
        Convert the JSON string to an object of the given type. Conversion will not be attempted if type is null or JSON is invalid.
        Parameters:
        objectType - Class type to deserialize into.
        json - valid JSON string
        Returns:
        Instantiated object from JSON string
        Throws:
        GeneralException - if JSON cannot be converted to object

      • listFromJson

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> listFromJson​(java.lang.Class<T> objectType,
                                                 java.lang.String json)
                                          throws GeneralException
        Convert the JSON string to a list of objects of the given type. Conversion will not be attempted if type is null or JSON is invalid.
        Parameters:
        objectType - Class type to deserialize list contents into.
        json - valid JSON string
        Returns:
        Instantiated list of objects from JSON string
        Throws:
        GeneralException - if string cannot be converted to object

      • mapFromJson

        public static <S,​T> java.util.Map<S,​T> mapFromJson​(java.lang.Class<S> keyType,
                                                               java.lang.Class<T> valueType,
                                                               java.lang.String json)
                                                        throws GeneralException
        Convert the JSON string to a map. If keyType or valueType are null and JSON is invalid, conversion will not be attempted.
        Parameters:
        keyType - Class type to deserialize map keys.
        valueType - Class type to deserialize map values.
        json - valid JSON string
        Returns:
        Instantiated map from JSON string
        Throws:
        GeneralException - if JSON cannot be converted to map

      • listOfMapsFromJson

        public static <S,​T> java.util.List<java.util.Map<S,​T>> listOfMapsFromJson​(java.lang.Class<S> keyType,
                                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> valueType,
                                                                                      java.lang.String json)
                                                                               throws GeneralException
        Convert the JSON string to a list of maps. Conversion will not be attempted if keyType or valueType is null or JSON string is invalid.
        Parameters:
        keyType - Class type to deserialize map keys.
        valueType - Class type to deserialize map values.
        json - valid JSON string
        Returns:
        Instantiated list of maps from JSON string
        Throws:
        GeneralException - if the JSON cannot be converted to a map

      • computeDiff

        public static java.lang.String computeDiff​(java.lang.String earlierJson,
                                           java.lang.String laterJson)
        Computes the difference between two JSON strings. The result will be a JSON PATCH document. Applying the PATCH document to the earlierJson string would result in the laterJson string. No formatting is applied to the result.
        Parameters:
        earlierJson - first JSON string to be used in the comparison
        laterJson - second JSON string to be used in the comparison
        Returns:
        unformatted JSON PATCH document representing operation applied to the earlierJson string to get the laterJson string

      • computeDiff

        public static java.lang.String computeDiff​(java.lang.String earlierJson,
                                           java.lang.String laterJson,
                                           boolean pretty)
        Creates a JSON PATCH document representing the difference between two JSON strings. The PATCH document may include 'replace', 'add', and/or 'remove' operation. The JSON string should be different snapshots in time of the same object.
        Parameters:
        earlierJson - JSON string representing the earlier snapshot/version of the object
        laterJson - JSON string representing the later snapshot/version of the object
        pretty - true to convert the JSON PATCH document to an easy-to-read format
        Returns:
        JSON PATCH document representing the JSON differences

      • patchDocReplay

        public static java.lang.String patchDocReplay​(java.lang.String jsonStr,
                                              java.lang.String... patchDocs)
        Given an initial JSON string, apply a series of jakarta PATCH documents in order to get to a current state of the object. The PATCH documents must be applied in the correct order. This only makes sense for consecutive PATCH documents originating from the same JSON. This cannot be enforced and will generate a bad result if the patches aren't related to the JSON string.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string representing the initial state of an object. Must be a valid JSON string. Required.
        patchDocs - series of jakarta PATCH documents. Must be valid PATCH documents. Null or empty documents are ignored. If no PATCH documents provided, the input string is returned unaltered.
        Returns:
        JSON string representing the original JSON with the patches applied. The input JSON will be returned if there are no PATCH documents to apply and the input JSON has a valid value. Null will be returned if the input JSON is null, not valid, or an error occurs while applying patches.

      • getJsonNode

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getJsonNode​(java.lang.String jsonStr)
                                                           throws sailpoint.tools.JsonParseException
        Convert a valid JSON string into a node object. If the JSON string cannot be converted to a JsonNode, a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - valid JSON string to be converted
        Returns:
        node representation of the JSON string. Null if the string has no value.
        Throws:
        sailpoint.tools.JsonParseException - if the string cannot be converted to JsonNode

      • findJsonProperty

        public static java.lang.String findJsonProperty​(java.lang.String jsonStr,
                                                java.lang.String propPath)
        Returns the value of a JSON property as a JSON string. The property will be searched from the root node given the path value. The returned value can be a primitive, object, or array, i.e. whatever is assigned to the property within the node. Double quotes are not removed from the return value.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string representing the root node.
        propPath - JSON path for which to search the node. Uses a JSON format, e.g. /parent/child/property; /parent/child/array/0
        Returns:
        value assigned to the path within the root node

      • findJsonProperties

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> findJsonProperties​(java.lang.String jsonStr,
                                                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> propPathMap)
        Convenience (and efficency) method used to return multiple values from a JSON string in a single call. The input map contains a mapping of key/propPath mappings. If the path is found in the JSON, it will be added to the return map using the key value. Example: key = entityID propPath = /fields/id - the return would have entityID/a372au83 where a372au83 is the value of id.

        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string from which to find the properties
        propPathMap - map containing key/propPath pairs
        Returns:
        mapping of key/propValue pairs

      • findJsonNode

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode findJsonNode​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                                   java.lang.String propPath)
        Returns a JsonNode representing the entity at the provided path within the root node.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root node from which to seek the property
        propPath - JSON style path, e.g. /parent/child/prop; /parent/child/array/0
        Returns:
        node representing the item at the specified path within the root node. Null if the root node and/or path are empty.

      • findJsonArrayItems

        public static java.util.List<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> findJsonArrayItems​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                                                         java.lang.String propPath,
                                                                                         java.lang.String propName,
                                                                                         java.lang.String expectedPropValue)
        Searches an array of objects for a particular property with a particular value. It will return a list of all matching objects. It will only process arrays of objects, i.e. if the path points to a primitive, object, no work will be done. The array referenced by the path must be an array of objects. Any type other than object is ignored.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root node from which to find the array property
        propPath - JSON path identifying the array, e.g. /root/array
        propName - property name within the object contained in the array
        expectedPropValue - value to match if the object is to be returned
        Returns:
        list of matching array objects

      • findJsonProperty

        public static java.lang.String findJsonProperty​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                java.lang.String propPath)
        Returns the value of a JSON property as a JSON string. The property will be searched from the root node given the path value. The returned value can be a primitive, object, or array, i.e. whatever is assigned to the property within the node. Double quotes are not removed from the return value.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - starting or root node
        propPath - JSON path for which to search the node. Uses a JSON format, e.g. /parent/child/property; /parent/child/array/0
        Returns:
        value assigned to the path within the root node

      • findJsonPropertyAsString

        public static java.lang.String findJsonPropertyAsString​(java.lang.String rootJson,
                                                        java.lang.String propPath)
        Parameters:
        rootJson - JSON string representing a root JSON node
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a String or null if not found or not a text type
        See Also:
        findJsonPropertyAsString

      • findJsonPropertyAsString

        public static java.lang.String findJsonPropertyAsString​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                        java.lang.String propPath)
        Extracts the value of the JSON property from the JSON node as a String. If the path is not found, null will be returned. Object and array properties will be returned as a string as well as primitives.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a String or null if not found

      • findJsonPropertyAsInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer findJsonPropertyAsInteger​(java.lang.String rootJson,
                                                          java.lang.String propPath)
        Parameters:
        rootJson - JSON string representing a root JSON node
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as an Integer or null if not found or not an integer type
        See Also:
        findJsonPropertyAsInteger

      • findJsonPropertyAsInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer findJsonPropertyAsInteger​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                          java.lang.String propPath)
        Extracts the value of the JSON property from the JSON node as an Integer. If the path is not found or the type cannot be converted to an Integer, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as an Integer or null if not found, or it cannot be converted to an integer

        Parameters:

        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:

        See Also:
        findJsonPropertyAsLong

      • findJsonPropertyAsLong

        public static java.lang.Long findJsonPropertyAsLong​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                    java.lang.String propPath)
        Extracts the value of the JSON property from the JSON node as a Long. If the path is not found or cannot be converted to a Long, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a Long or null if not found or cannot be converted to long

      • findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean findJsonPropertyAsBoolean​(java.lang.String rootJson,
                                                          java.lang.String propPath)
        Parameters:
        rootJson - JSON string representing a root JSON node
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a Boolean or null if not found or not a boolean type
        See Also:
        findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

      • findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean findJsonPropertyAsBoolean​(java.lang.String rootJson,
                                                          java.lang.String propPath,
                                                          boolean defaultValue)
        Parameters:
        rootJson - JSON string representing a root JSON node
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        defaultValue - default value to return if the property is not found or not a boolean type
        Returns:
        value of property as a Boolean, or defaultValue if not found or not a boolean type
        See Also:
        findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

      • findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean findJsonPropertyAsBoolean​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                          java.lang.String propPath)
        Extracts the value of the JSON property from the JSON node as a Boolean. If the path is not found or the type cannot be converted to a Boolean, null will be returned.

        Non-boolean Rules: 1. number values not 0 will be true 2. string value of "true" is true anything else is false

        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a Boolean or null if not found or cannot be converted to a boolean

      • findJsonPropertyAsBoolean

        public static boolean findJsonPropertyAsBoolean​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                java.lang.String propPath,
                                                boolean defaultValue)
        Extracts the value of the JSON property from the JSON node as a boolean. If the path is not found or the type cannot be converted to a Boolean, false will be returned.

        Non-boolean Rules: 1. number values not 0 will be true 2. string value of "true" is true anything else is false

        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a boolean, false if not found or cannot be converted to a boolean

        Parameters:

        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node

        findJsonPropertyAsDate

      • findJsonPropertyAsDate

        public static java.util.Date findJsonPropertyAsDate​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootJsonNode,
                                                    java.lang.String propPath)
        Extracts the value of the long JSON property from the JSON node as a Date. If the path is not found or the type cannot be converted to long and then from long to Date, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rootJsonNode - root JSON node from which to search for the property
        propPath - JSON path of the property to find in the JSON node
        Returns:
        value of property as a Date or null if not found or cannot be converted to a date

      • makePretty

        public static java.lang.String makePretty​(java.lang.String json)
        Changes a valid JSON string into an easy-to-read form.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON string to be converted. It must be a valid JSON format.
        Returns:
        easy-to-read format of the JSON string. Null if the JSON string has no value.

      • makePrettyNoEscapes

        public static java.lang.String makePrettyNoEscapes​(java.lang.String json)
        Changes a valid JSON string into an easy-to-read form. Does not escape HTML codes.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON string to be converted. It must be a valid JSON format.
        Returns:
        easy-to-read format of the JSON string. Null if the JSON string has no value.

      • cleanseJson

        public static java.lang.String cleanseJson​(java.lang.String json,
                                           boolean prettyPrint)
        If a JSON string has null properties and/or empty array properties, this method will cleanse the JSON string of those items. It will convert to a Map and re-serialize to apply the object mapper config properties.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON string to be cleansed. Null/empty is ignored.
        prettyPrint - true if the resulting JSON string should be pretty-printed
        Returns:
        JSON string without null/empty properties

      • makeUnpretty

        public static java.lang.String makeUnpretty​(java.lang.String json,
                                            JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Changes a valid formatted JSON string into a valid non-formatted JSON string.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON string to be converted. It must be a valid JSON format.
        options - object mapper configuration options
        Returns:
        unformatted JSON string. Null if the JSON string has no value.

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid​(java.lang.String jsonStr)
        True if the JSON string is well-formed.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string to check
        Returns:
        true if the JSON string is well-formed.

      • isScalar

        public static boolean isScalar​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node)
        Checks to see if the JsonNode is a number, text, boolean, or binary.
        Parameters:
        node - JsonNode to check
        Returns:
        true if the node represents a scalar type

      • isJsonNodesEqual

        public static boolean isJsonNodesEqual​(java.lang.String jsonStr1,
                                       java.lang.String jsonStr2)
        Checks to see if two JSON strings are equal. In order to be true, the nodes must be of the same type along with the following: - if both are null - if an array, all items must equal regardless of order - if an object, all fields must match regardless of order - else, string representation of nodes must match

        Parameters:
        jsonStr1 - first JSON string to compare
        jsonStr2 - second JSON string to compare

        Returns:
        true if the nodes are equal

      • buildObjectString

        public static java.lang.String buildObjectString​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node)
        Builds a string that can be used for a generic JsonNode comparison. It will check the node type and call the proper method.
        Parameters:
        node - JsonNode to be used for conversion
        Returns:
        a string representing the node value or empty string if node is null

      • buildObjectString

        public static java.lang.String buildObjectString​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ArrayNode aNode)
        Builds a string that can be used for array node comparison.
        Parameters:
        aNode - ArrayNode to be used for conversion
        Returns:
        a string representing the node value or empty string if node is null

      • buildObjectString

        public static java.lang.String buildObjectString​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode oNode)
        Builds a string that can be used for object node comparison.
        Parameters:
        oNode - ObjectNode to be used for conversion
        Returns:
        a string representing the node value or empty string if node is null

      • isJsonNodesEqual

        public static boolean isJsonNodesEqual​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node1,
                                       com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node2)
        Checks to see if two JsonNode objects are equal. Order of properties or array elements shouldn't matter. It will make a call to isJsonSortedEqual(...) first. If that returns false, it's a short circuit condition and no more work to do. If it returns true, it will need to be confirmed with a more detail check. See the comments for isJsonSortedEqual(...) for details.

        Parameters:
        node1 - first node to check
        node2 - second node to check
        Returns:
        true if the JSON objects match

      • isJsonObject

        public static boolean isJsonObject​(java.lang.String jsonStr)
        Checks to see if a JSON string is likely to be an object, i.e. wrapped with braces. There exists some strings that are wrapped in braces, but not valid JSON. Verifying the JSON format is expensive, but has to be checked because of string similar to "{ some string value}".
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string to check
        Returns:
        true if the jsonStr is wrapped with braces

      • isJsonArray

        public static boolean isJsonArray​(java.lang.String jsonStr)
        Checks to see if a JSON string is likely to be an array, i.e. wrapped with brackets. There exists some strings that are wrapped in brackets, but not valid JSON. Verifying the JSON format is expensive, but has to be checked because of string similar to "[some string value]".
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - JSON string to check
        Returns:
        true if the jsonStr is wrapped with brackets

      • isJsonObject

        public static boolean isJsonObject​(java.lang.Object obj)
        If the object is a string, check to see if it is a JSON object structure.
        Parameters:
        obj - object to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the object is not null, a string, and matches a valid JSON object format; else false.

      • isJsonArray

        public static boolean isJsonArray​(java.lang.Object obj)
        If the object is a string, check to see if it is a JSON array structure.
        Parameters:
        obj - object to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the object is not null, a string, and matches a valid JSON array format; else false.

      • updateJsonProperty

        @SafeVarargs
public static java.lang.String updateJsonProperty​(java.lang.String jsonString,
                                                  sailpoint.tools.Pair<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object>... pathValuePairs)
                                           throws GeneralException
        Allows one or more properties within a JSON string to be updated. The JSON string will be updated using the collection of path/value pairs. The path must exist and the value cannot be null. The value must also match the type of the property or be "castable" to the property type.

        Parameters:
        jsonString - JSON string to be updated. If provided, it must be valid.
        pathValuePairs - valid path/value pairs. If not provided, the original JSON string will be returned

        Returns:
        null if both JSON string and pairs are missing; original JSON string if no pairs are provided; JSON string with updates applied.

        Throws:
        GeneralException - for invalid JSON string; invalid path/value pair; value cast error
